trans-unit.source: Provides the information necessary to create an instance of an object.
This class cannot be inherited.
InstanceDescriptor can store information that describes an instance of an object.
This information can be used to create an instance of the object.
Some custom serializers use InstanceDescriptor to represent serializable objects.
Several methods of a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> use InstanceDescriptor to represent or instantiate objects.
An InstanceDescriptor provides the following members: - A <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor.MemberInfo%2A> property that describes this object.
- An <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor.Arguments%2A> property that consists of the constructor arguments that can be used to instantiate this object.
- A Boolean <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor.IsComplete%2A> property that indicates whether the object is completely represented by the current information.
- An <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor.Invoke%2A> method that can be used to create an instance of the represented object.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor"></xref> class using the specified member information and arguments.
The member information for the descriptor.
This can be a <xref:System.Reflection.MethodInfo>, <xref:System.Reflection.ConstructorInfo>, <xref:System.Reflection.FieldInfo>, or <xref:System.Reflection.PropertyInfo>.

If this is a <xref:System.Reflection.MethodInfo>, <xref:System.Reflection.FieldInfo>, or <xref:System.Reflection.PropertyInfo>, it must represent a <xref uid="langword_csharp_static" name="static" href=""></xref> member.
The collection of arguments to pass to the member.
This parameter can be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> or an empty collection if there are no arguments.
The collection can also consist of other instances of <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor"></xref>.
member is of type , , or , and it does not represent a member.
member is of type and is not readable.
member is of type or , and the number of arguments in arguments does not match the signature of member.member is of type and represents a member.
member is of type , and the number of arguments in arguments is not zero.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor"></xref> class using the specified member information, arguments, and value indicating whether the specified information completely describes the instance.
The member information for the descriptor.
This can be a <xref:System.Reflection.MethodInfo>, <xref:System.Reflection.ConstructorInfo>, <xref:System.Reflection.FieldInfo>, or <xref:System.Reflection.PropertyInfo>.

If this is a <xref:System.Reflection.MethodInfo>, <xref:System.Reflection.FieldInfo>, or <xref:System.Reflection.PropertyInfo>, it must represent a <xref uid="langword_csharp_static" name="static" href=""></xref> member.
The collection of arguments to pass to the member.
This parameter can be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> or an empty collection if there are no arguments.
The collection can also consist of other instances of <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor"></xref>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified information completely describes the instance; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
member is of type , , or , and it does not represent a member member is of type and is not readable.
member is of type or and the number of arguments in arguments does not match the signature of member.
member is of type and represents a member member is of type , and the number of arguments in arguments is not zero.
Gets the collection of arguments that can be used to reconstruct an instance of the object that this instance descriptor represents.
An <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> of arguments that can be used to create the object.
Invokes this instance descriptor and returns the object the descriptor describes.

This method creates a new instance of the object indicated by the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor.MemberInfo%2A> property, using the specified arguments to create that particular type of instance.
The object this instance descriptor describes.
Gets a value indicating whether the contents of this <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor"></xref> completely identify the instance.
Typically, an <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor> completely describes a particular instance.
However, some objects are too complex for a single method or constructor to represent.

IsComplete indicates whether an <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor> is incomplete, so a user can identify these objects and perform additional processing, if necessary, to further describe their state.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the instance is completely described; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the member information that describes the instance this descriptor is associated with.
The value of this property can be a <xref:System.Reflection.MethodInfo>, <xref:System.Reflection.ConstructorInfo>, <xref:System.Reflection.FieldInfo>, or <xref:System.Reflection.PropertyInfo>.
A <xref:System.Reflection.MemberInfo> that describes the instance that this object is associated with.
